comment: An almost perplexing blend from Balvenie.  You get the very distinct toffee and citrus flavor.  There is quite a bit going on within the whisky, but it is definitely a high quality drink
A bit on the sweet smooth side. I like it!
must have.tasted twice and loved many

I've had this one for almost 10 months, and I finally decided to taste it.  Without going into tedious details, Tun 1509 Batch 1 is a very good whisky. It is complex and nuanced, both nosing and on the palate. No strong flavors jump out; rather, it's a unique and well balanced gentle harmony of many flavors, sip after sip.  Amanda's review here on Distiller called it "delicate" and I can agree with that.

I think Balvenie has done a fine marketing job ratcheting up the anticipation of this limited annual release. As good as it is, for me it's overpriced. No regrets buying it, though I don't think I'll try to buy any subsequent releases. This bottle will last quite a while, and I'll enjoy each sip.
Great balance.  Wonderful whisky, but damn expensive.
Excellent.  Almost as good as the 30 year.

Nose: dried fruits and honey

Palate: apples, nutmeg, cinnamon, a lovely spice 

One of the best whiskies I've ever had. Cannot wait to buy a bottle to enjoy for years.
Really, really smooth. Caught hints of brown sugar. Wonderful to sip.
Part of our flight at scotch night. Happy to have tried this.
